page.title: 05Hurstpierpoint Theatre
page.content: At the eastern end of Hurstpierpoint High Street is the{theatre.}It was built around 1894 as an Evangelical chapel, and since then it has been a school, a wire store, a grocer's and a supermarket. It was empty for four years, and then it was bought by Hurstpierpoint players. After numerous {fund_raising events}and the selling off of two kiosks at the front of the building, the money was raised for sets, stage lights, a bar, proper curtains and about 90 seats. The first of many performancies at the theatre was a review called{ {"Consider Yourself at Home". Let us hope that the theatre will still be here to entertain people for many more years to come.
